text: Josiah Robins Bonner Jr. (born November 19, 1959) is a former American politician who was the U.S. Representative for Alabama's 1st congressional district from 2003 to 2013. He is part of the Republican Party. He left his job in Congress on August 2, 2013, to take a job with the University of Alabama. He currently serves as chief of staff to Alabama Governor Kay Ivey. ==Election history== ==References== Category:1959 births Category:United States representatives from Alabama Category:People from Selma, Alabama Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Living people
title: Jo Bonner
